H0.text: Development of claws is the structural adaptation most likely selected for in the population of Animal X, which relies on two food sources—one in water and one on land—and whose main predator is found only on land.

H1.text: Increase in leg strength is the most likely structural adaptation selected for in a population of Animal X that has two food sources—one in water and one on land—when its main predator is found only on land.

H2.text: An increase in visual acuity is the most likely structural adaptation selected for in a population of Animal X that has food sources both in the water and on land, when its main predator is found only on land.

H3.text: Development of webbed feet is the most likely structural adaptation that will be selected for in the population of Animal X, which has two food sources—one in water and one on land—and whose main predator is found only on land.

A4.text: Adaptation is the evolutionary process whereby populations of organisms become better able to live in a habitat or habitats.

A5.text: All adaptations help organisms survive in their ecological niches.
